title: Quiz 6: Comprehensive Final Exam
description: A comprehensive review covering all topics: History, Research, Biology, Learning, Intelligence, Emotion, and Disorders.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines 'Psychology'?

options.text: The study of the brain and nerves
The scientific study of behavior and mental processes
The study of mental disorders only

questions.explanation: Psychology encompasses the scientific study of both observable behavior and internal mental processes.

questions.question: Match the key figure to their contribution:
questions.explanation: Wundt=father of psychology; Pavlov=dogs; Skinner=box/reinforcement; Maslow=pyramid.

questions.question: In an experiment, the group that receives the treatment is the ___ group, while the group that does not is the ___ group.
questions.explanation: The Experimental group gets the manipulation; the Control group serves as a baseline.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ refers to the smallest amount of stimulus needed to notice its presence, while ___BLANK___ refers to the smallest detectable change in stimulation.
questions.explanation: Absolute Threshold is detection from zero; Difference Threshold (JND) is detection of change.

questions.question: Down Syndrome is a result of a sex-chromosome abnormality (missing or extra X/Y).
questions.explanation: Down Syndrome is an Autosomal Trisomy (Trisomy 21), involving the 21st pair of non-sex chromosomes.

questions.question: Which of the following scenarios describes 'Negative Reinforcement'?

options.text: A child gets candy for cleaning their room
A driver puts on a seatbelt to stop the annoying beeping sound
A student is suspended for fighting
A dog is ignored when it barks

questions.explanation: Negative reinforcement increases behavior (wearing seatbelt) by removing an unpleasant stimulus (beeping).
questions.hint: Removing something bad to increase behavior.

questions.question: Order the steps of the Motivation Cycle:
You have two job offers. One pays well but is boring; the other is exciting but pays poorly. This is an example of what type of conflict?
questions.explanation: Double Approach-Avoidance involves two alternatives, each having both positive (pay/excitement) and negative (boring/poor pay) qualities.
questions.hint: Two options, both have pros and cons.

questions.question: What is the term for a false belief (e.g., believing one is being persecuted by the CIA) that cannot be changed despite evidence to the contrary?
questions.explanation: A delusion is a fixed, false belief often seen in psychotic disorders like Schizophrenia.

questions.question: Select all the defense mechanisms from the list below:
questions.explanation: Projection, Rationalization, and Displacement are defense mechanisms. Introspection is a research method; Perception is a cognitive process.
